intro: Scagea oligostemon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scagea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its ecosystem.
